title: Fred Malek
added: In August 1959, Malek and four other men were arrested in Vicary's Park near [[Peoria, Illinois]] after a dog was killed, eviscerated and barbecued on a spit. Charges of cruelty to animals were later dismissed against all but one of the men, Andrew P. O'Meara, who testified that he alone had struck and killed the dog, skinned it and tried to cook it, in order to teach the others something about living off the land.<ref name="bbq" /><ref>{{cite news |last1=Luciano |first1=Phil |title=New political probe pales next to long-ago dog barbecue |url=https://www.eveningtribune.com/article/20080213/NEWS/302139938 |newspaper=[[The Evening Tribune (Hornell)|The Evening Tribune]] |accessdate=11 August 2020 |date=2008-02-13 |location=[[Hornell, New York]]}}</ref>

The story came up again when Malek became an advisor and fundraiser to Sarah Palin in the [[2008 United States presidential election|2008 presidential campaign]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Dunn |first1=Geoffrey |title=Dog Eat Dog: Palin Patron's Checkered Past |url=https://www.huffpost.com/entry/dog-eat-dog-palin-patrons_b_163385 |work=[[HuffPost]] |accessdate=13 August 2020}}</ref> Amid accusations that Malek himself had killed and barbecued the dog,<ref name="bbq">{{cite news |first=Colbert I. |last=King |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2006/03/10/AR2006031001843_pf.html |title=Fred Malek, a Dog, and the SEC |newspaper=[[The Washington Post]] |date=March 11, 2006 |page=A19}}</ref> Malek, in his blog, quoted O'Meara, a retired Army Colonel, taking "full responsibility" for what happened.<ref>{{cite web |first=Fred |last=Malek |url=http://www.fredmalekblog.com/2008/03/04/setting-the-record-straight/ |title=Setting the Record Straight |work=Fred Malek Blog |date=March 4, 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080408000745/http://www.fredmalekblog.com/2008/03/04/setting-the-record-straight/ |archive-date=2008-04-08}}</ref>

During the [[2012 United States presidential election|2012 presidential campaign]] the incident once again came up when Malek's hosting of [[Ann Romney]]'s birthday party was brought up by the semi-satirical group Dogs Against Romney.<ref>{{cite magazine |last1=Reeve |first1=Elspeth |title=Why Can't People Forgive Fred Malek for a Little Dog-Roasting? |url=https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2012/04/why-cant-people-forgive-fred-malek-little-dog-roasting/329338/ |magazine=[[The Atlantic]] |accessdate=11 August 2020 |date=April 13, 2012}}</ref>
